summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The email discusses providing notice of court proceedings to a newly added statutory victim under the Crime Victim Rights Act and informs about upcoming court appearances including an arraignment and a bail appeal oral argument.

persons.name: Jack Scarola
persons.context: Attorney receiving and sending emails regarding court proceedings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, appears to be representing or coordinating with a victim.

persons.name: Michael Danchuk
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who sent the initial email providing notice of court proceedings and inquiring about victim notification preferences.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, subject of the superseding indictment and upcoming court appearances.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Judge presiding over the case who scheduled an in-person arraignment for April 23, 2021.

connections.description: Prosecutor communicating with attorney regarding victim notification and court proceedings in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
Attorney involved in the Maxwell case, appears to be representing or coordinating on behalf of a victim in the case.
Assistant United States Attorney prosecuting the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: In-person arraignment scheduled before Judge Nathan at courtroom 24B, 500 Pearl Street at 2:30 p.m.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: Remote oral argument scheduled at the Second Circuit Court of Appeals at 10 a.m. regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, courtroom 24B (Southern District of New York courthouse)
keyFacts: A superseding indictment has added a new statutory victim to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecution is providing notice of court proceedings to this victim pursuant to the Crime Victim Rights Act.
Two significant court appearances were scheduled: an in-person arraignment on April 23, 2021, and a remote bail appeal oral argument on April 26, 2021.
The email correspondence shows coordination between the prosecution and victim representation regarding legal notifications.
The document reveals ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell case in April 2021, including both district court and appellate court activities.
